page.title: 05The Compleat Angler
page.content: {The Compleat Angler}was built in {Marlow}sometime before 1658. It is one of the most expensive hotels in {Buckinghamshire.}The Hotel was run by a family until five years ago when it was taken over by Trust House Forte. It was first called The Waterside Inn, when an author called Izaac Walton wrote a book while he was staying there called{The Compleat {Angler,}and so it was renamed in 1659. The facilities available for the guests are tennis courts, a helicopter launching pad, twenty four hour food services and a valet service. If you wanted to stay there it would cost you Â£60 a night without breakfast, Â£75 for a double room and Â£160 for a suite. President Ford and President Carter have both stayed there. Ali McGraw spent over Â£6000 when she spent a holiday there.
